text.div:
BC AssertionPresenceStatement Logical Model

Statement that a finding is present.

name: AssertionPresenceStatementModel
title: BC AssertionPresenceStatement Logical Model
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC)
description: Statement that a finding is present.

element.definition: Statement that a finding is present.

element.short: The person this entry belongs to.
element.definition: The person this entry belongs to.

element.short: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program, as distinct from who recorded the entry.
element.definition: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program, as distinct from who recorded the entry.

element.short: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program, as distinct from who recorded the entry.
element.definition: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program, as distinct from who recorded the entry.

element.short: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.
element.definition: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

element.short: Provenance information specific to the signing of the clinical statement.
element.definition: Provenance information specific to the signing of the clinical statement.

element.short: Base class - independent of context - for all kinds of determinations: questions/answers, conditions, observations, allergies, and other findings.
element.definition:
Base class - independent of context - for all kinds of determinations: questions/answers, conditions, observations, allergies, and other findings.
The subject of a finding can be the entire patient, or an entity such as a location body structure, intervention, or condition. Things observed about the subject can include social and behavioral factors, subjective and objective observations, and assessments.

element.short: PresenceContext indicates that the finding in question exists or is present to some level of certainty.
element.definition:
PresenceContext indicates that the finding in question exists or is present to some level of certainty.
For example, if the finding involves a myocardial infarction, the presence context implies that cardiac arrest has (or may have) taken place. Note that the name Presence is used rather than Present to prevent confusion with the temporal meaning of present.
